summary: Email correspondence between a US Department of Justice communication technician at MCC-New York and Justin Houston of SigNet Technologies regarding the procurement of a specific Seagate 320GB hard drive. The document shows routine administrative procurement activity at the Metropolitan Correctional Center where Jeffrey Epstein was held.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.role: Program Manager FBOP Contracts at SigNet Technologies
persons.context: Program manager at SigNet Technologies who is contacted by a DOJ communication technician regarding procurement of a specific hard drive model.

events.title: Hard Drive Procurement Inquiry
events.description: A US Department of Justice communication technician at MCC-New York emails Justin Houston of SigNet Technologies seeking an alternate part number for a Seagate 320GB hard drive.

locations: MCC-New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
SigNet Technologies, 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705
keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated March 14, 2018 regarding hardware procurement for MCC-New York.
A DOJ communication technician at MCC-New York is seeking a specific Seagate 320GB hard drive (Model: ST3320620AV, P/N: 9DC04G-501).
Justin Houston of SigNet Technologies is identified as the Program Manager for FBOP (Federal Bureau of Prisons) contracts.
The correspondence shows routine administrative activity at the Metropolitan Correctional Center where Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated.
The document includes standard confidentiality disclaimers indicating it contains potentially protected information.
